business.headline: Can Reko Diq's gold mine end Pakistan's economic crisis? Reko Diq is one of the world's largest undeveloped copper and gold reserves, with the potential to produce 200,000 tons of copper and 250,000 ounces of gold annually for over half a century.
Premier Energies shares make bumper D-Street debut, lists at 120% premiumPremier Energies listing: The shares opened at a premium of 120% on BSE, listing at Rs 991.
Sensex, Nifty open flat after record highs; Infosys down 1% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 43.82 points to 82,516.02, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 7.95 points to 25,270.75.

Gold, silver price today, September 3, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today September 3, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

No salary paid to Madhabi Buch after retirement: ICICI Bank on Congress's claimMadhabi Buch served as the CEO of ICICI Securities from February 2009 to May 2011. In a statement, the bank said it has not paid any salary or granted any ESOPs to Buch after her retirement, other than her retiral benefits.

RBI: 97.96% of Rs 2,000 notes withdrawn, Rs 7,261 crore yet to returnAs of August 30, 2024, only Rs 7,261 crore worth of these notes remain with the public, according to the data released by RBI on Monday.

IndiGo's gender-specific seating for women travellers sees 60-70% rise in AugustIndiGo launched this gender-specific seating option in May 2024 as a pilot project, aimed at increasing the comfort and security of women travellers.

Government approves Rs 3,300 crore semiconductor unit in Gujarat's SanandThis unit represents India's fifth semiconductor facility and is part of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) to build a robust semiconductor ecosystem.

Union Cabinet approves Rs 13,966 crore boost for agriculture, food securityThe decision was made during a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, with the goal of supporting farming activities and improving the lives of farmers.
Sensex, Nifty close on record high driven by gains in IT and FMCG stocks The S&P BSE Sensex added 194.07 points to close at 82,559.84, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 42.80 points to end at 194.07.

Dunzo cuts 75% of workforce as Reliance-backed firm battles financial woesThe decision to cut jobs comes as part of a larger strategy to manage expenses and generate cash flow, as the company faces increasing pressure to meet its financial obligations.

These 3 IT stocks could deliver quick gains in short term. Check hereTech Mahindra is one of the 3 IT stocks that is currently showing a strong bullish trend, visible across both its daily and weekly charts.
Government to increase budget allocation for agriculture sector: ReportThe Union Cabinet may also discuss merging various agricultural schemes into a more streamlined approach.

Gala Precision Engineering IPO opens for bidding: Subscribe or skip? Gala Precision Engineering Limited, established in February 2009, focusses on manufacturing precision components like disc and strip springs (DSS), coil and spiral springs (CSS), and specialised fastening solutions (SFS).

Suzlon Energy shares up 109% from March low: What should investors do? In the past year, Suzlon Energy shares have delivered a return of 193%, and over the past two years, the gain has been a remarkable 909%.

ECO Mobility IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusECO Mobility IPO allotment: Investors who applied for ECO Mobility Limited IPO can check their allotment status online via the BSE website or through Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high driven by a rally in IT and auto stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 155.32 points to 82,521.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 77.20 points to 25,313.10.

Commercial LPG cylinders to get costlier from today, price hiked by Rs 39The price of commercial LPG cylinders has been increased nationwide, with a Rs 39 hike in Delhi for a 19 kg cylinder, now priced at Rs 1,691.50 as of September 1.
Lok Sabha polls, reduced spending: RBI Governor's reasons for Q1 GDP fallIndia's GDP growth slowed to 6.7 per cent in the April-June quarter, down from 8.2 per cent a year ago.

JP Morgan and ISG partner to bring ONDC seller app at Global Fintech Fest 2024The partnership creates a 'one stop shop' solution for digital commerce by leveraging ISG's ONDC tech stack, powered by its ecosystem partner Protean, and the banking capabilities of JP Morgan in India.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 3 Coast Guard members missing after chopper's emergency sea landingAn Indian Coast Guard helicopter with four crew members on board was reportedly forced to make an emergency landing in the Arabian Sea off the coast of Porbandar on Monday night.

'IC 814' row: Why Netflix India content head has been summoned todayThe government directed Netflix India content chief Monika Shergill to appear before it today to explain the allegedly contentious aspects of the streaming platform's series 'IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack', top sources said.

Haryana student mistaken for cow smuggler, chased for 25 km, killedFive people, identified as cow vigilantes, were arrested on charges of killing a Class 12 student after mistaking him for a cattle smuggler in Faridabad.
I am safe: Singer AP Dhillon's post after shots fired outside his Canada homeSinger AP Dhillon reacted after shots were fired outside his Canada home. He confirmed that he was safe.

Memorial jewellery, re-release of movies: Why nostalgia means big moneyOur love for nostalgia – a longing for the past – has not only helped revive the theatre business after OTT platforms almost swallowed it, but it has also built many brands and businesses.

Egg on face: BJP on ICICI's response to Congress claims on Sebi chief's salaryThe fresh flashpoint between the BJP and Congress comes after the latter accused the SEBI chairperson of holding an office of profit at ICICI Bank.

Hamas's 'new orders' on handling hostages amid outrage over deaths: ReportHamas official Abu Ubaida's statement happened to coincide with the discovery of six more dead hostages in Gaza. Israel's military claims the hostages were executed shortly before troops could reach them.

PM on historic first visit to Brunei today, then to Singapore to boost tiesPM Modi's visit to Brunei will be the first ever by an Indian head of state, despite 40 years of diplomatic ties between the two nations.
IIM professor defends Navya Nanda's admission, calls it purely merit-basedNavya Nanda's admission to IIM Ahmedabad has sparked online criticism, but an IIM professor has defended her merit.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Navy's Rs 70,000-crore warship project, Army's 1,700-tank proposal to be approvedDefence Ministry sources told India Today TV that the Defence Acquisition Council (DAC) is expected to clear projects worth over Rs 1.3 lakh crore in the meeting scheduled to be held on Tuesday.

India wins 8 medals on magical Monday at ParalympicsIt was a fine day for India at the Paris Paralympics on September 2, Monday as Sumit Antil and Nitesh Kumar claimed gold medals. India bagged a total of 8 medals on the day.

KBC 16: The Rs 25 lakh question about Rabindranath Tagore that stumped a contestant'Kaun Banega Crorepati 16,' hosted by Amitabh Bachchan, saw contestant Shreem Sharma miss a chance to win Rs 25 lakh. Can you answer the Rabindranath Tagore question that stumped him?

Meeting between Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus and extremist leader sparks rowThe August 31 meeting between Bangladesh interim government's chief adviser Muhammad Yunus and Hefazat-e-Islam leader Mamunul Haque raised several concerns, given the extremist group's history of maintaining an anti-India stance.

Will Congress field Vinesh Phogat in Haryana polls? Suspense to end todayThe Congress' Central Election Committee has approved 34 candidates for the Haryana assembly elections, with the final list expected by Wednesday. Speculation about Vinesh Phogat's candidacy will be resolved by Tuesday.

BJP on Nitesh Rane's anti-Muslim remarks: 'Such words have no space in public life'Participating in a debate on India Today TV, BJP spokesperson Tuhin Sinha condemned Nitesh Rane's recent remarks where the latter openly threatened the Muslim community.

Nadal sides with Sinner amid doping row, says 'justice is justice'Rafael Nadal defended Jannik Sinner, expressing trust in the verdict clearing him of intentional doping. Despite controversy, Sinner's US Open run continues strong, with a Round of 16 clash against Tommy Paul on September 3.

Rahul Gandhi keen on AAP-Congress alliance in Haryana polls: SourcesCongress MP Rahul Gandhi raised the possibility of his party having an alliance with Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP for the October 5 Haryana Assembly polls during the Congress's Central Election Committee (CEC) meeting, sources told India Today TV.

French man accused of recruiting over 50 strangers to rape wife after drugging herThe main accused, a 71-year-old former employee at France's power utility EDF, is facing trial along with 50 other men in the southern city of Avignon. The men are charged with raping the woman, who, as per her lawyer, was so heavily drugged that she was not aware of the sexual abuse.

Salman Khan house firing: Accused claims conspiracy of being killed by Dawood's gangSalman Khan house firing case: It is said that the brothers had met the accused where they were allegedly told about having heard some conspiracies being hatched about getting killed by Dawood Ibrahim's henchmen.

Bengal anti-rape bill constitutionally valid, but needs President's assent: ExpertsLegal experts said the West Bengal government's move to introduce an anti-rape bill in the state Assembly was constitutionally valid, but it will require presidential assent for it to become a law.

Tim Walz unhurt after his motorcade involved in highway crash in MilwaukeeTim Walz was unhurt as his vehicle wasn't involved in the crash. However, a staff member in one of the press vans sustained a broken arm, while others in the convoy were treated for minor injuries.

Pressure on Pakistan as Bangladesh inch closer to historic series sweepRain remains the only challenge for Bangladesh in its bid to cleansweep its Test series 2-0 against Pakistan. Bangladesh put themselves in a strong position on Monday, 2 September after they rattled Pakistan with the ball.

Brazil's Supreme Court unanimously upholds nationwide ban on XA bench of Brazilian Supreme Court has unanimously upheld the decision of one of its justices to block billionaire Elon Musk's social media platform X nationwide.

When Amitabh Bachchan worked for free in Mohanlal's film on Kandahar hijackActor Amitabh Bachchan once starred in a film about the 1999 Kandahar hijack. Titled 'Kandahar', the 2010 film was headlined by Malayalam actor Mohanlal.
Hina Khan says '5 chemo infusions done, 3 more to go'Hina Khan shared her health update with a video message on Instagram. Sharing a video, the actor said that she is still fighting.

'IC 814' row: Plea filed in Delhi High court seeking ban on OTT series A plea has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking a ban on the latest Netflix series 'IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack.' The series directed by Anubhav Sinha, was released on August 29.

Imtiaz Ali-Sajid hint at new love story after 'Laila Majnu': 'Next love legend?'Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali recently dropped a major hint about his possible collaboration with 'Laila Majnu' director Sajid Ali after the film was re-released in theatres.

sports.headline: Sinner bests Tommy Paul to seal quarterfinal, Beatriz scripts historyJannik Sinner advanced to the US Open quarterfinals, defeating Tommy Paul and becoming the only player to reach the quarters in all four Grand Slams this year. On the same day, Beatriz Haddad Maia also made history as the first Brazilian woman to do the same.

'Sixer King' Priyansh Arya calls Virat Kohli his favourite, wishes to play for RCBPriyansh Arya expressed his admiration towards Virat Kohli and called him his idol. He wished to play alongside him for RCB in IPL.

Victor Osimhen joins Galatasaray on 1-year loan deal after Napoli fallout Victor Osimhen's surprise loan to Galatasaray follows a fallout with Napoli and failed Chelsea transfer, signaling a likely permanent separation despite a lowered release clause and contract extension option until 2027.

US Open: Swiatek seals 2nd US Open quarter-final berth, De Minaur beats ThompsonIga Swiatek and Alex de Minaur stormed into the quarter-final of US Open 2024. Swiatek beat Liudmila Samsonova 6-4 6-1 and De Minaur beat Thompson 6-0 3-6 6-3 7-5.

Jos Butler in doubt for England vs Australia T20Is after calf-injuryJos Buttler's calf injury setback puts his participation in England's T20I series against Australia in doubt, specifically after re-aggravating the injury during his rehab. Sam Curran and Phil Salt emerge as potential stand-ins as the team remains hopeful for Buttler's recovery.

Karolina Muchova knocks out Jasmine Paolini, Jessica Pegula in quartersUS Open 2024: Karolina Muchova made her way through to the quarterfinals after beating Jasmine Paolini. Jessica Pegula also secured a comprehensive win over Diana Shnaider.

PM Narendra Modi congratulates Sumit Antil for defending javelin crownParis Paralympics: PM Narendra Modi praised javelin thrower Sumit Antil for winning the gold medal in the F64 event on Monday with a best throw of 70.59 metres.

Who is Thulasimathi Murugesan? Veterinary Science student claims historic silverA veterinary science student aiming for greatness in sports, Thulasimathi Murugesan achieved history on Monday, September 2, when she got the silver medal in the Women's Badminton Singles SU5 event.

Who is Manisha Ramadass? India's first woman with badminton medal Paralympics 2024: 19-year-old Manisha Ramadass won bronze in the SU5 category and became the first Indian woman with a medal in badminton at the quadrennial event.

Paris 2024: Thulasimathi Murugesan gets silver Women's Badminton Singles SU5India's Thulasimathi Murugesan claimed silver in the Women's Badminton Singles SU5 event on Monday, September 2 after losing to China's Yang Qiuxia. Yang, the defending champion, won the match 21-17, 21-10.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
